TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed OutputCacheProfileCollection extends System.Configuration.ConfigurationElementCollection

Docs.summary: Represents a collection of objects. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The OutputCacheProfileCollection allows to centralize the management of the output cache settings used by pages or user controls.
It allows you to programmatically access and modify the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.OutputCacheProfile> objects it contains.
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.OutputCacheProfile> can be applied to a page using the `CacheProfile` attribute of the [@ OutputCache](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/28a9e101-fb44-4198-9cb6-b8a52312fec2) directive.
## Examples The following code example shows how to obtain the OutputCacheProfileCollection object.
[!code-cs[System.Web.Configuration.OutputCacheProfileCollection#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.configurati_39_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.OutputCacheProfileCollection#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.configurati_39_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Clear() cil managed

Docs.summary: Removes all the objects from the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method inserts a `clear` directive into the corresponding section of the configuration file to clear all references to elements defined in a higher-level configuration file. All elements defined in the corresponding section of the current configuration file are removed.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the Clear method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Remove(string name) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the element to remove from the collection.
Docs.summary: Removes the object with the specified name from the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The Remove method inserts a `remove` element into the appropriate section of the configuration file for any element defined in a higher-level configuration file. If the element is defined in the appropriate section of the current configuration file, its entry is removed from the configuration file. The object to remove must exist in the collection.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the Remove method.
[!code-cs[System.Web.Configuration.OutputCacheProfileCollection#8](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.web.configurati_54_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.OutputCacheProfileCollection#8](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.configurati_54_1.vb)]

Docs.exception: There is no object with the specified key in the collection, the element has already been removed, or the collection is read-only.
